replies.body:
They're all great, but I'm especially in love with the Lux icons.

I hope the artist they had make these makes the future icons.

I'm glad you  like these.

We are looking to take the "mid-year" mage roster project as a oppurtunity update the icons for some of the older mages we are working on, most likely using the same artists.

> [{quoted}](name=Reav3,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=kBR25M27,comment-id=00000001,timestamp=2016-02-04T17:12:18.942+0000)
>
> I'm glad you  like these.
> 
> We are looking to take the "mid-year" mage roster project as a oppurtunity update the icons for some of the older mages we are working on, most likely using the same artists.

I enjoy the work the team is doing here but....
Can you please politely ask  them to not make all the icons so homogenized?

http://imgur.com/PmIDI5d

Ive noticed a certain growing trend with these Icon updates.
I would prefer the Icons to be somewhat unique and interesting.
Cool, I will pass that feedback along to the artists.

Please stress especially that icons should NOT all have the same color. 

It's been done with quite a few of the updated icons, Ashe and Poppy are prime example, and not only makes it look them rather bland (seriously look at Ashes icons, it's just 4 times a white arrow with a blue background from different angles),
 it also makes it difficult to tell them apart at a glance. When I can only look at them for a split second in a teamfight I have actualy problems to quickly tell if my if it's my W or my E that's on CD on Poppy because all her icons boil down to 

ORANGE STUFF1, ORANGE STUFF2, ORANGE STUFF3, ORANGE STUFF4.

"not the same color" is probably a bit too specific, but your ultimate point that "icons should be distinguishable at first glance" is a very good one. Take my +1

But there can be other ways than color to distinguish 2 icons.

...actually that is intended, it is nice to see the icons more synchronized within themselves rather having a patchwork of messy colours.

Probably some are a bit bland icon wise... but honestly, we can' t complain about some champs. Ashe is all about arrows :P

> [{quoted}](name=Reav3,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=kBR25M27,comment-id=0000000100000000,timestamp=2016-02-04T22:40:28.550+0000)
>
> Cool, I will pass that feedback along to the artists.

I would like to second that as well. 

Another point is that some of the new icons for a champ are all the same color, which doesn't look as nice. Each of Lux's new icons have an unique color combination. But Gragas's new ones are all magenta outside of his passive and his Q and E especially look the same when they are small or out of the corner of one's eye.

The art itself looks wonderful, the icons for a champ just need to be more diverse in color.
*still waits for Janna and Anivia icons*
